pageTitle: Comments - Doug MacCash, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune | NOLA.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {56811=Dear muspench, grrlyfern, and everyone Thanks so much for watching and writing. About physical difficulty: I'm a few years older than James, but I'd kept up the pace for the whole 2005 trip. Almost. Near the end, we were pedaling up the (I think) Carrollton overpass on I-10, when I just couldn't go another inch. So I called out to James, who was a little in front of me, that I had to stop and rest. He stopped and said, "Thank God. I couldn't give up before the old man.", 60742=Thanks 7870 Faubourg. I had not been biking much this summer, so Saturday's trek was pretty tough. My legs are still a little wobbly. I was younger in 2005, of course, and adrenaline might have played a role. Doug MacCash, 48984=Have no fear chentrails; I was busy this week preparing a new sort of video. It's an Arts and Entertainment weekend preview. Check it out. Tell me what you think. http://www.nola.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2010/10/video_new_orleans_entertainmen.html, 52037=Dear emr1boricua, Thanks for reading and writing. I too have heard that the practice can be found in Central America. Also, someone told me that this goes back at least 20 years in New Orleans -- though I'd never noticed it until maybe last year. But here's another mystery: How did your comment about anti-fly bags end up in the blog about giant concrete sculpture? Here's the fly bag story: http://www.nola.com/arts/index.ssf/2010/09/do_those_fly_repellant_water_b.html, 80506=© 2015 NOLA Media Group. All rights reserved (About Us).
